title: Fire cape

properties.name: description
properties.value: The fire cape is a melee cape obtained as a reward for completing the TzHaar Fight Cave. It is the second best melee cape in the game, outclassed only by the infernal cape.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Fire cape
This article is about the item obtained by defeating the TzTok-Jad. For the reward for achieving level 99 Firemaking, see Firemaking cape.
For the item obtained by defeating TzKal-Zuk, see Infernal cape.

SMW Subobject for NormalExamine: A cape of fire.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Fire capeUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Fire cape.pngWeight: 1.814Value: 65007Version anchor: NormalRelease date: 4 October 2005Item ID: 6570

The fire cape is a melee cape obtained as a reward for completing the TzHaar Fight Cave. It is the second best melee cape in the game, outclassed only by the infernal cape.

In order to obtain the fire cape, players must survive all waves of TzHaar Fight Caves and defeat TzTok-Jad. Note that the cape will not be awarded should both the player and TzTok-Jad die simultaneously, even though the boss log will count the kill. The player must be taken out of the cave by the game recognising TzTok-Jad's death; if they are removed from the cave due to dying, the game considers the player to have failed the challenge.

A fire cape must be shown to TzHaar-Ket guards around the centre of the city to allow further access to Mor Ul Rek. This does not consume the fire cape. However, to enter the Inferno, a fire cape must be sacrificed by giving it to TzHaar-Ket-Keh. This is a one-time fee.

If the player dies below level 20 Wilderness, it will remain in the player's inventory; however, the item will be unusable and must be repaired by using it on Perdu and paying him 50,000. If not protected when the player dies at level 20 wilderness or higher, the cape is converted into coins. Alternatively, a Trouver parchment and a payment of 500,000 coins can be given to Perdu in order to lock it (after which it gains the (l) suffix); this allows the item to be kept in death, unbroken, even if the player dies at level 20 Wilderness or higher.

Comparison[edit | edit source]

The fire cape is very popular for many forms of melee combat and is often the cape of choice, only surpassed by the strictly better, but much more difficult to obtain Infernal cape. In certain scenarios, other capes may be preferred for their higher accuracy bonuses, prayer bonus or for being easier to obtain or replace.

ItemAttack BonusesDefence BonusesOther
Infernal cape44411121212121280%021.8
Fire cape11111111111111140%021.8
Mythical cape006008888810%011.8
Ardougne cloak 4600606006000%060.5
Obsidian cape000009999900%001.8

Other uses[edit | edit source]

This item can be stored in the cape rack of a costume room. It can also be mounted on a cape hanger in an Achievement Gallery of a player-owned house. This has no effect other than showing the player's guests that the player has completed the Fight Cave.

Players who don't want their cape can sell it to TzHaar-Mej-Jal for their choice of a chance of obtaining the Tzrek-jad pet or 8,000 Tokkul. A lost fire cape can only be replaced by surviving the Fight Caves again to receive another one.

The fire cape can be combined with the max cape to change its appearance by turning it into the fire max cape.

The fire cape counts as warm clothing when fighting the Wintertodt.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

Tier Emotes STASH Location Items Cost
Master Cry TzHaar-Hur-Lek's Ore and Gem Store in Mor Ul Rek 1,472

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
6 October 2016
(update)

The fire cape texture has been improved so seams are less visible.

8 August 2013
(update)

Some feedback changes have been made to the config costs of the fire cape, rune defender and penance items, including the penance skirt.

2 August 2013
(update | poll)
  • The fire cape's value was increased from 60,000 to 65,007 to allow it to be protected over rune armour on death.
  • Fire capes can now be obtained even when the player already has one, and they can be exchanged for tokkul.
22 January 2007
(update)

The item was graphically updated.

16 January 2007
(update)

The item's inventory sprite was rotated.

Gallery (historical)[edit | edit source]
19 September 2005

22 January 2007 		22 January 2007
present

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Using an item on the fire cape results in a game message stating "That doesn't seem to do what you want it to." instead of the usual "Nothing interesting happens." message.
  • The first NPC to wear this cape was the Slayer master Nieve.
  • The fire cape, fire max cape, infernal cape, and infernal max cape are the only capes to have an animated texture whilst wearing it.
  • There is a glitch, which can sometimes occur when a player opens their bank or scrolls too quickly within their bank, where the inventory icon may become animated. This also affects other animated items such as magic logs and dramen branches.

{{External|rs}} {{Otheruses|the item obtained by defeating the [[TzTok-Jad]]|the reward for achieving level 99 [[Firemaking]]|Firemaking cape}} {{Otheruses|def=no|the item obtained by defeating [[TzKal-Zuk]]|Infernal cape}} {{Infobox Item |version1 = Normal |version2 = Broken |version3 = Locked |name1 = Fire cape |name2 = Fire cape (broken) |name3 = Fire cape (l) |image1 = [[File:Fire cape.png]] |image2 = [[File:Fire cape (broken).png]] |image3 = [[File:Fire cape.png]] |release1 = [[4 October]] [[2005]] |release2 = [[21 July]] [[2016]] |release3 = [[29 August]] [[2019]] |update1 = TzHaar Fight Caves |update2 = Broken Armour & Open Beta |update3 = Last Man Standing (2019) |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = No |placeholder = Yes |equipable1 = Yes |equipable2 = No |equipable3 = Yes |stackable = No |noteable = No |options1 = Wear |options2 = None |options3 = Wear |destroy = Drop |examine1 = A cape of fire. |examine2 = A broken cape of fire. |examine3 = A cape of fire. |value1 = 65007 |value2 = 1 |value3 = 65007 |alchable = No |weight = 1.814 |id1 = 6570 |id2 = 20445 |id3 = 24223 }} {{Synced switch |version1 = [[File:Fire cape detail animated.gif|left|A fire cape's animation when dropped.]] |version2 = [[File:Fire cape (broken) detail.png|left|150x150px]] |version3 = [[File:Fire cape detail animated.gif|left|A fire cape's animation when dropped.]] }} The '''fire cape''' is a [[melee cape]] obtained as a reward for completing the [[TzHaar Fight Cave]]. It is the second best melee cape in the game, outclassed only by the [[infernal cape]]. In order to obtain the fire cape, players must survive all waves of TzHaar Fight Caves and defeat [[TzTok-Jad]]. Note that the cape '''will not''' be awarded should both the player and TzTok-Jad die simultaneously, even though the [[boss log]] will count the kill. The player must be taken out of the cave by the game recognising TzTok-Jad's death; if they are removed from the cave due to dying, the game considers the player to have failed the challenge. A fire cape must be shown to [[TzHaar-Ket]] guards around the centre of the city to allow further access to [[Mor Ul Rek]]. This does not consume the fire cape. However, to enter the [[Inferno]], a fire cape must be sacrificed by giving it to [[TzHaar-Ket-Keh]]. This is a one-time fee. If the player dies below level 20 [[Wilderness]], it will remain in the player's inventory; however, the item will be unusable and must be repaired by using it on [[Perdu]] and paying him {{Coins|50000}}. If not protected when the player dies at level 20 wilderness or higher, the cape is converted into [[coins]]. Alternatively, a [[Trouver parchment]] and a payment of 500,000 coins can be given to [[Perdu]] in order to lock it (after which it gains the (l) suffix); this allows the item to be kept in death, unbroken, even if the player dies at level 20 Wilderness or higher. {{Infobox Bonuses |version1 = Normal |version2 = Broken |version3 = Locked |astab = 1 |aslash = 1 |acrush = 1 |amagic = 1 |arange = 1 |dstab = 11 |dslash = 11 |dcrush = 11 |dmagic = 11 |drange = 11 |str = 4 |rstr = 0 |mdmg = 0 |prayer = 2 |slot = cape |image = [[File:Fire cape equipped.gif]] |altimage = [[File:Fire cape equipped female.png]] }} ==Comparison== The fire cape is very popular for many forms of melee combat and is often the cape of choice, only surpassed by the strictly better, but much more difficult to obtain [[Infernal cape]]. In certain scenarios, other capes may be preferred for their higher accuracy bonuses, prayer bonus or for being easier to obtain or replace. {{Infotable Bonuses|Infernal cape#Normal|Fire cape#Normal|Mythical cape|Obsidian cape|Ardougne cloak 4|sort=str,prayer|order=desc,desc|nototals=yes}} ==Other uses== {{Costume storage|cape rack}} It can also be mounted on a [[cape hanger]] in an [[Achievement Gallery]] of a [[player-owned house]]. This has no effect other than showing the player's guests that the player has completed the Fight Cave. Players who don't want their cape can sell it to [[TzHaar-Mej-Jal]] for their choice of a chance of obtaining the [[Tzrek-jad]] pet or 8,000 [[Tokkul]]. A lost fire cape can only be replaced by surviving the [[TzHaar Fight Cave|Fight Caves]] again to receive another one. The fire cape can be combined with the [[max cape]] to change its appearance by turning it into the [[fire max cape]]. The fire cape counts as warm clothing when fighting the [[Wintertodt]]. ==Treasure Trails== {{EmoteClueHeader}} {{EmoteClue|tier=master|emote=Cry|location=[[TzHaar-Hur-Lek's Ore and Gem Store]] in [[Mor Ul Rek]]|item1=Fire cape|cost=0|item2=toktz-xil-ul}} {{EmoteClueBottom}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 6 October 2016 |update = The Hill Giant Boss |poll = |change = The fire cape texture has been improved so seams are less visible. }} {{Subject changes |date = 8 August 2013 |update = Patch Notes (8 August 2013) |change = Some feedback changes have been made to the config costs of the fire cape, rune defender and penance items, including the penance skirt. }} {{Subject changes |date = 2 August 2013 |update = Patch Notes (2 August 2013) |poll = Old School feature poll 7 |change = * The fire cape's value was increased from 60,000 to 65,007 to allow it to be protected over rune armour on death. * Fire capes can now be obtained even when the player already has one, and they can be exchanged for tokkul. }} {{Subject changes |date = 22 January 2007 |update = The Lair of Tarn Razorlor |change = The item was graphically updated. }} {{Subject changes |date = 16 January 2007 |update = Interfaces and spooky wallpapers |change = The item's inventory sprite was rotated. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Fire cape detail (historical, v1).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Fire cape detail (historical, v2).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Fire cape detail animated.gif|center|300x150px]] |- |[[File:Fire cape (historical, v1).png|center]] |[[File:Fire cape (historical, v2).png|center]] |[[File:Fire cape.png|center]] |- |19 September 2005
